page.title: 07ARCHITECTURE
page.content:
The{Origins}of Ballymoney go back to a {Norman Tower House}which stood in Castle Street,guarding the main communications route to the river Bann. At the junction of Charlotte Street and Main Street is the{Masonic {Hall,}built as a market house by the Earl of Antrim around 1775.
Charlotte Street, named after the Countess of Antrim in 1826,contains some fine examples of late{Georgian {town houses}with facades,fanlights and attractive doorcases. Also in this street{Westoncrofts,a small Georgian {mansion,}with arched Tuscan porch,now the property of the R.U.C.. The{Court {House,}an unusual building with a vitruvian doorway,was erected by Sir Charles Lanyon in 1837. The{Manor {House,}another fine Georgian building is now in a very poor state of repair.
